User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user on the Tabdeel platform.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user entity.

avatarUrl.description: URL of the user's avatar image.

preferences.description: List of category IDs representing the user's interests.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the user account was created.

lastSeen.description: Timestamp indicating the last time the user was active on the platform.

Item.title: Item
Item.description: Represents an item listed for barter on the Tabdeel platform.

images.description: Array of URLs pointing to images of the item.

condition.description: Condition of the item (e.g., Like New, Good, Fair).

city.description: City where the item is located.

desiredKeywords.description: Keywords describing what the owner wants in exchange for the item.

desiredCategories.description: List of category IDs representing the items the owner desires in exchange.

status.description: Status of the item (e.g., active, exchanged, removed).

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the item was listed.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the item was last updated.

embeddings.description: Array of floating-point numbers representing the item's text embeddings.

SwapRequest.title: SwapRequest
SwapRequest.description: Represents a request to swap items between two users.

id.description: Unique identifier for the swap request entity.

targetItemId.description: Reference to Item. (Relationship: Item 1:N SwapRequest) The item that is being requested.

targetOwnerId.description: Reference to User. (Relationship: User 1:N SwapRequest) The owner of the target item.

requesterId.description: Reference to User. (Relationship: User 1:N SwapRequest) The user making the swap request.

offeredItemIds.description: References to Items. (Relationship: Item N:N SwapRequest) List of item IDs offered by the requester in the swap.

message.description: Message from the requester to the item owner.

status.description: Status of the swap request (e.g., pending, accepted, declined, countered).

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the swap request was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the swap request was last updated.

Message.title: Message
Message.description: Represents a message within a swap request or a direct chat.

id.description: Unique identifier for the message entity.

swapRequestId.description: Reference to SwapRequest. (Relationship: SwapRequest 1:N Message).  The swap request this message belongs to.  If null, it's a direct message.

senderId.description: Reference to User. (Relationship: User 1:N Message) The user who sent the message.

attachments.description: List of URLs pointing to attached files (e.g., images).

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the message was sent.

params.name: itemId

definition.description: Stores swap requests for an item. Includes denormalized 'targetOwnerId' and 'requesterId' for authorization independence.

params.name: targetOwnerId
params.description: The unique identifier for the owner of the target item.

params.name: targetItemId
params.description: The unique identifier for the target item.

params.name: swapRequestId
params.description: The unique identifier for the swap request.

definition.description: Stores messages associated with a specific swap request.

params.name: targetOwnerId
params.description: The unique identifier for the owner of the target item in the swap request.

params.name: targetItemId
params.description: The unique identifier for the target item in the swap request.

params.name: swapRequestId
params.description: The unique identifier for the swap request.

params.name: messageId
params.description: The unique identifier for the message.

params.name: categoryId
params.description: The unique identifier for the category.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to be secure, scalable, and debuggable. The key change is moving 'items' to a top-level collection. This is crucial for the 'Explore' page, allowing for efficient querying of all items across all users without needing a complex and costly collection group query. Ownership is maintained via the 'ownerId' field within each item document. User profiles remain in '/users/{userId}'. Swap requests and messages remain nested to logically group them and simplify security rules, ensuring only involved parties can access them.
